title: BACnetAddListElement (Function)
text:
FUNCTION BACnetAddListElement :
IEC_BACNET_STATUS
Sends an Add-List-Element request
Return:
IEC_BACNET_STATUS

rows.Name: pSourceAddress
rows.Comment:
If the BACnet application has only one device constructed and installed, this can
be NULL. In this case the MAC address of this device will be used. Otherwise this
shall be the MAC address returned on device object construction.

rows:
This is the MAC address of the device to which the request
should be sent.

A pointer to a data structure which contains all service parameters this service
provides and the application needs to process.

A pointer to the structure which contains a set of APDU properties to control the
timing and size of transmitted frames for this request. It temporarily overwrites the
global APDU settings made in the source device from which this request is sent and which
parameters would control this request if this pointer is NULL.
Transaction token of the asynchronous call - seeBACnetAsyncTransactionToken.

In case of any service execution error the error result will be stored in the structure
this pointer references. This parameter may be NULL if the application isnât interested
in detailed error information.

A pointer to memory in which the API stores in case of some error the count of the
first element which could not be processed. This argument may be NULL.
